maml:description.maml:para: Returns a connection to a Microsoft Dynamics 365 instance.

The Get-CrmConnection cmdlet returns a connection to a Dynamics 365 instance. Upon successful connection to Dynamics 365, it returns an initialized instance of the Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.CrmServiceClient class. This cmdlet applies to Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Online and on-premises).

Connection string used to connect to Dynamics 365. Valid parameters are:
Server/Url/ServiceUri/ Service Uri = URL to the CRM API Server
UserName/User Name/UserId/User Id = User ID to connect to the CRM server
Password = Password for the user id
Domain = Domain name for the user id
HomeRealmUri/Home Realm Uri = Home Realm Url to access the delegated ADFS instance
AuthType/AuthenticationType = Auth type to use. Default is AD Valid values are: AD , Live , IFD, Claims, Office365, OAuth
RequireNewInstance = defaults to true, false to reused an in memory cache
CientId / AppId / ApplicationId = ID of your oAuth client app. Required for OAuth Auth Type
RedirectUri/ReplyUrl = ReplyUrl created as part of the client id registration. Required for OAuth Auth Type
TokenCacheStorePath = Fully qualified file name to store tokens in for reuse. Optional for OAuth Type
LoginPrompt = Allow the OAuth system to prompt the UX for login information. Default is Auto Valid values are : Auto , Always , Never , RefreshSession

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Geographic region of your Microsoft Dynamics 365 online deployment. Valid values are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2.
Unique or friendly name of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 organization to connect to.

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
URL of the on-premises Microsoft Dynamics 365 server specified in the following format: http://<server>:<port>.
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Unique or friendly name of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 organization to connect to.
URI of the WS-Trust metadata endpoint.

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.

Connection string used to connect to Dynamics 365. Valid parameters are:
Server/Url/ServiceUri/ Service Uri = URL to the CRM API Server
UserName/User Name/UserId/User Id = User ID to connect to the CRM server
Password = Password for the user id
Domain = Domain name for the user id
HomeRealmUri/Home Realm Uri = Home Realm Url to access the delegated ADFS instance
AuthType/AuthenticationType = Auth type to use. Default is AD Valid values are: AD , Live , IFD, Claims, Office365, OAuth
RequireNewInstance = defaults to true, false to reused an in memory cache
CientId / AppId / ApplicationId = ID of your oAuth client app. Required for OAuth Auth Type
RedirectUri/ReplyUrl = ReplyUrl created as part of the client id registration. Required for OAuth Auth Type
TokenCacheStorePath = Fully qualified file name to store tokens in for reuse. Optional for OAuth Type
LoginPrompt = Allow the OAuth system to prompt the UX for login information. Default is Auto Valid values are : Auto , Always , Never , RefreshSession
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Geographic region of your Microsoft Dynamics 365 online deployment. Valid values are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2.
URI of the WS-Trust metadata endpoint.

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
Unique or friendly name of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 organization to connect to.
URL of the on-premises Microsoft Dynamics 365 server specified in the following format: http://<server>:<port>.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-CrmConnection -ConnectionString "AuthType=AD;Url=http://mycrmserver/Contoso;Domain=mycrmserverdom;Username=user1;Password=password"
IsReady : True IsBatchOperationsAvailable : True Authority : OAuthUserId : ActiveAuthenticationType : AD OrganizationServiceProxy : Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Client.OrganizationServiceProxy OrganizationWebProxyClient : LastCrmError : OrganizationWebProxyClient is null LastCrmException : CrmConnectOrgUriActual : http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc ConnectedOrgFriendlyName : Contoso ConnectedOrgUniqueName : Contoso ConnectedOrgPublishedEndpoints : {[WebApplication, http://mycrmserver/Contoso], [OrganizationService, http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc], [OrganizationDataService, http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc]} ConnectionLockObject : System.Object ConnectedOrgVersion : 8.2.0.729 CallerId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 SdkVersionProperty :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a connection to an on-premises instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365 using the connection string. On successful connection, it returns an initialized instance of Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.CrmServiceClient.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-CrmConnection -OrganizationName Contoso -ServerUrl http://mycrmserver -Credential $Cred
IsReady : True IsBatchOperationsAvailable : True Authority : OAuthUserId : ActiveAuthenticationType : AD OrganizationServiceProxy : Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Client.OrganizationServiceProxy OrganizationWebProxyClient : LastCrmError : OrganizationWebProxyClient is null LastCrmException : CrmConnectOrgUriActual : http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc ConnectedOrgFriendlyName : Contoso ConnectedOrgUniqueName : Contoso ConnectedOrgPublishedEndpoints : {[WebApplication, http://mycrmserver/Contoso], [OrganizationService, http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc], [OrganizationDataService, http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc]} ConnectionLockObject : System.Object ConnectedOrgVersion : 8.2.0.729 CallerId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 SdkVersionProperty :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a connection to an on-premises instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365. On successful connection, it returns an initialized instance of Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.CrmServiceClient.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-CrmConnection -OrganizationName org1 -DeploymentRegion Northamerica -OnLineType Office365 -Credential $Cred
IsReady : True IsBatchOperationsAvailable : True Authority : https://login.windows.net/cff7431e-fzd3-4273-a130-7b7f5007dcd0/oauth2/authorize/ OAuthUserId : user1@myCrmOnline.onmicrosoft.com ActiveAuthenticationType : OAuth OrganizationServiceProxy : OrganizationWebProxyClient : Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.WebServiceClient.OrganizationWebProxyClient LastCrmError : LastCrmException : CrmConnectOrgUriActual : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc ConnectedOrgFriendlyName : org1 ConnectedOrgUniqueName : orgc304eba7 ConnectedOrgPublishedEndpoints : {[WebApplication, https://mycrmonline.crm.dynamics.com/], [OrganizationService, https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc], [OrganizationDataService, https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc]} ConnectionLockObject : System.Object ConnectedOrgVersion : 8.2.0.729 CallerId : 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 SdkVersionProperty :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a connection to an online instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365. On successful connection, it returns an initialized instance of Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.CrmServiceClient.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Microsoft Dynamics 365 organizations that the current user has access to.
The Get-CrmOrganizations cmdlet returns a list of Microsoft Dynamics 365 organizations that the current user has access to. This cmdlet applies to Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Online and on-premises).
URL of the on-premises Microsoft Dynamics 365 server specified in the format http://<server>:<port>.
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Geographic region of your Microsoft Dynamics 365 online deployment. Valid vales are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
URL of the on-premises Microsoft Dynamics 365 server specified in the format http://<server>:<port>.
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
URI of the WS-Trust metadata endpoint.

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
User credential for signing in to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Geographic region of your Microsoft Dynamics 365 online deployment. Valid vales are NorthAmerica, EMEA, APAC, SouthAmerica, Oceania, JPN, CAN, IND, and NorthAmerica2
URI of the WS-Trust metadata endpoint.

Custom directory location to store the Xrm.Tooling.Connector log files. The directory must already exist, and the user who is running the cmdlet must have Write permission to the directory. You must also use the -Verbose parameter along with the -LogWriteDirectory parameter to be able to store the log files in a custom location.
Maximum time in minutes that Xrm.Tooling.Connector will wait for any given Dynamics 365 SDK command to complete.
Type of online deployment. Valid value is Office365.
URL of the on-premises Microsoft Dynamics 365 server specified in the format http://<server>:<port>.
Returns an initialized array of Organizations that can be used to login to, or null.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-CrmOrganizations -ServerUrl http://mycrmserver -Credential $Cred
DiscoveryServerShortname : DiscoverySeverName : FriendlyName : Contoso UniqueName : Contoso Version : 8.2.0.729 OrganizationUrl : http://mycrmserver/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc WebApplicationUrl : http://mycrmserver/Contoso OrganizationRestUrl : http://myCrmServer/Contoso/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc OrganizationWebAPIUrl : http://mycrmserver/Contoso/api/data/v8.2/
DiscoveryServerShortname : DiscoverySeverName : FriendlyName : Fabrikam UniqueName : Fabrikam Version : 8.2.0.729 OrganizationUrl : http://mycrmserver/Fabrikam/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc WebApplicationUrl : http://mycrmserver/Fabrikam OrganizationRestUrl : http://mycrmserver/Fabrikam/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc OrganizationWebAPIUrl : http://mycrmserver/Fabrikam/api/data/v8.2/

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to retrieve the organizations from an on-premises instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365. On successful connection to Microsoft Dynamics 365, the cmdlet returns an initialized list of Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.Connector.CrmOrganizationInfo objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-CrmOrganizations -DeploymentRegion NorthAmerica -OnLineType Office365 -Credential $Cred
DiscoveryServerShortname : NorthAmerica DiscoverySeverName : North America FriendlyName : org1 UniqueName : orgc304eba7 Version : 8.2.0.729 OrganizationUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc WebApplicationUrl : https://mycrmonline.crm.dynamics.com/ OrganizationRestUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc OrganizationWebAPIUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v8.2/
DiscoveryServerShortname : NorthAmerica DiscoverySeverName : North America FriendlyName : org2 UniqueName : orgc304zpa3 Version : 8.2.0.729 OrganizationUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/Organization.svc WebApplicationUrl : https://mycrmonline.crm.dynamics.com/ OrganizationRestUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc OrganizationWebAPIUrl : https://mycrmonline.api.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v8.2/

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to retrieve the organizations from an online instance of Microsoft Dynamics 365. On successful connection to Microsoft Dynamics 365, the cmdlet returns an initialized list of Microsoft.Xrm.Tooling.Connector.CrmOrganizationInfo objects.
